intro: Cistus × canescens f. albus, commonly known as the white rockrose, is a hybrid shrub native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is characterized by its silvery-white, fuzzy foliage and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to the local flora. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
